questions.question:
Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) =2 − 2x + 5x^4 + 7x^5 + \int_{-1}^{1} (x - t ) u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = 1 + 7x + 20x^2 + x^3 − \int_{0}^{1} (10xt^2 + 20x^2t)u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) = xe^x + \frac{xe^{x+1} + 1}{(x + 1)2} - \int_{0}^{1} e^{xt} u(t) dt ? $
(Hint: using the Modified Decomposition Method )

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = 2 + 5x - 3x^2 + \int_{-1}^{1} (1 - xt ) u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which is the equivalent Integral Equation for the BVP
$ y'' + 4y = 0, 0< x < 1, y(0) = y'(1) = 0 ? $

variants.title: $ u(x) = x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}t,\;0 \le t \le x\\x,\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}2t,\;0 \le t \le x\\2x,\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = sin x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}2t(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\2x(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = -2x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}tx(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\x(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}4t,\;0 \le t \le x\\4x,\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $

questions.question:
Which is the solution of the
Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) = e^x - x + x\int_0^1 t u(t) dt $
(Hint: using Adomian Decomposition Method)

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = −8 + 11x − x^2 + x^3 − \int_{0}^{1} (12x − 20t)u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) = 1 - \frac{1}{15} x^2 + \int_{-1}^{1} (xt + x^2t^2) u(t) dt $
(Hint: using Adomian Decomposition Method)

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = -2 +\sin x + \int_{-\pi/2}^{\pi/2} t u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which is the equivalent Integral Equation for the BVP
$ y'' + xy = 0, 0< x < 1, y(0) = y(1) = 0 ? $

variants.title: $ u(x) = 1 + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}2t(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\2x(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}xt(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\x^2(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = cos x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}4t(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\4x(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}xt(1 + x),\;0 \le t \le x\\x^2(1 + t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = x^2 + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}4x(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\4t(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $

questions.question:
Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = 5x + \int_{-1}^{1} ( 1 - xt) u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) = \frac{3}{2} e^{x} - \frac{1}{2}e^{x + 2} + \int_{0}^{1} e^{x + t} u(t) dt $
(Hint: using Adomian Decomposition Method)

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) = x + e^x − 2e^{x−1} + 2e^x − \int_{0}^{1} e^(x - t) u(t) dt ? $
(Hint: using the Modified Decomposition Method )

Which is the equivalent Integral Equation for the BVP
$ y'' + y = 0, 0< x < 1, y(0) = y'(1) = 0 ? $

variants.title: $ u(x) = -2x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}tx(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\x(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = sin x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}2t(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\2x(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}t,\;0 \le t \le x\\x,\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}t,\;0 \le t \le x\\x,\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = sin x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}4x(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\4t(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $

questions.question:
Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = 4 + 45x + 26x^2 − \int_{0}^{1} (1 + 30xt^2 + 12x^2t)u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = 1 + \frac{\pi}{2}\sec^2 x - \int_{0}^{\pi/4} \sec^2 x u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = 1 + \int_{0}^{1} (1 - 3xt) u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) = \sin x - x + \int_0^{\frac{\pi}{2}} xt \ u(t) dt $
(Hint: using Adomian Decomposition Method)

Find $ b=? $
If $ u(x)=-6e^{-x^2} $ is a solution of the
integral equation $ u(x)=-6b/2-b\int_0^x tu(t)dt $.

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = x^2 − x^3 + \int_{0}^{1} (1 + xt ) u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which is an eigenvalue of the equation
$ u(x) = \lambda \int_{0}^{1} 2e^{x + t} \ u(t)dt \ ? $

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = 1 + 3 \int_0^x (x - t) u(t)dt $
(Hint:using The Laplace Transform Method )

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = (\frac{2}{\sqrt{3}}-1)x + \sec x\tan x - \int_{0}^{\pi/6} x u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Integro-Differential Equations
is a class of integral equations.

Which is the solution of the equation
$ e^x -x - 1 = \int_0^x (x - t + 1) u(t) dt $
(Hint: using Laplace Transformation method)

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm integral equation system
$ \left\{ \begin{array}{l}u(x) = 9 + \int_0^1 t(u(t) + v(t))dt \\v(x) = 1 + \int_0^1 xt(u(t) - v(t))dt? \end{array} \right. $

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) = xe^x - \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{2} \int_0^{1} u(t) dt $
(Hint: using Adomian Decomposition Method)

Which is the converted form of the
Volterra Integral Equation of 1.kind
$ e^x - \cos x = \int_0^x e^{x - t} u(t) dt $
to the 2.kind ?

variants.title: $ u(x) = e^x + \sin x + \int_0^x e^{x + t}u(t) dt $
$ u(x) = e^x + \sin x - \int_0^x e^{x - t}u(t) dt $

questions.question:
Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = 1 + \int_{0}^{1} (1 - 3xt) u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm integral equation system
{u(x)=9+∫10xt(u(t)+v(t))dtv(x)=2+∫10t(u(t)−v(t))dt?$ \left\{ \begin{array}{l}u(x) = 9 + \int_0^1 xt(u(t) + v(t))dt \\v(x) = 2 + \int_0^1 t(u(t) - v(t))dt? \end{array} \right. $

Which is the solution of the equation
$ 1 + x + \frac{1}{2}x^2 + \frac{1}{3!}x^3 - \sin x - \cos x = \int_0^x (x - t + 1) u(t)dt \ ? $
(Hint: using Laplace Transformation method)

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) = \sin x - x + x \int_{0}^{\pi/2} t u(t) dt ? $
(Hint: using the Modified Decomposition Method )

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm integral equation system
{u(x)=12+∫10t(u(t)+v(t))dtv(x)=4+∫10xt(u(t)−v(t))dt?$ \left\{ \begin{array}{l}u(x) = 12 + \int_0^1 t(u(t) + v(t))dt \\v(x) = 4 + \int_0^1 xt(u(t) - v(t))dt? \end{array} \right. $

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm integral equation system
$ \left\{ \begin{array}{l}u(x) = 1 + \int_0^1 x(u(t) + v(t))dt \\v(x) = 3 + \int_0^1 x(u(t) - v(t))dt? \end{array} \right. $

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = (\frac{2}{\sqrt{3}}-1)x + \sec x\tan x - \int_{0}^{\pi/6} x u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which is the solution of the equation
$ x^2 + \frac{1}{6}x^3 = \int_0^x (2 + x - t) u(t) dt $ ?
(Hint: using Laplace Transformation method)

Which is the converted form of the
Volterra Integral Equation of 1.kind
$ e^x + \sin x - \cos x = \int_0^x 2e^{x − t } u(t)dt \ ? $
to the 2.kind ?

variants.title: $ u(x) =\frac{3}{2}(e^x - \cos x + \sin x - \int_0^x 2e^{x - t} u(t)\ dt) $
$ u(x) =\frac{1}{2}(e^x  + \cos x + \sin x - \int_0^x 2e^{x - t} u(t)\ dt) $
$ u(x) =\frac{1}{2}(e^x + \cos x + \sin x - \int_0^x e^{x - t} u(t)\ dt) $

questions.question:
Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = \cos x + \sin x − \int_0^x u(t)dt $
(Hint:use Modified Decomposition Method)

$ u(x) = 1 + \int_0^x \sin (x - t) u(t)dt $
(Hint:using The Laplace Transform Method )

$ u(x) = x + \sin x − \int_{0}^{\pi/2} xt u(t)dt $
(Hint: using The Successive Approximations Method )

$ u(x) = 1- \frac{1}{4} \int_{0}^{\pi/2} cosx\ u(t)dt $
(Hint: using The Successive Substitution Method )

$ u(x) = \frac{1}{2}x^2 - \int_0^x (x - t) u(t)dt $
(Hint:using The Successive Approximations Method)

$ u(x) = 5 + 2x^2 - \int_0^x (x - t) u(t) dt \ ? $
(Hint:use Adomian Decomposition Method)

$ u(x) = \frac{1}{3!}x^3 + \int_0^x (x - t)u(t)dt $

$ u(x) = 1- \frac{1}{4} \int_{0}^{\pi/2} cosx\ u(t)dt $
(Hint: using The Successive Substitution Method )

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = (π + 2)x + \sin x − \cos x − \int_{0}^{\pi} x(1 + u(t))dt $

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = 1+ \frac{1}{2} \int_{0}^{\pi/4} sec^2x\ u(t)dt $

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = \sin x + \sin x \int_{0}^{\pi/2} \cos t u(t)dt $

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = x + \sin x − \int_{0}^{\pi/2} xt u(t)dt $
(Hint: using The Successive Approximations Method )

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = x + e^x − \int_{0}^{1} xt u(t)dt $

$ u(x) = \frac{9}{10}x^3 + \frac{1}{2} \int_{0}^{1} x^3t u(t)dt $

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = sinx+ \frac{1}{2} \int_{0}^{\pi/2} cosx\ u(t)dt $

$ u(x) = x $ is a solution of the Fredholm integral equation

$ K(x,t) $, in a typical integral equation of the form

$ u(x) = f(x) + \int_{\alpha (x)}^{\beta(x)}\ K(x,t) \ u(t)\ dt. $
is called unknown function.

$ \alpha(x) $, and $ \beta(x) $, in a typical integral equation
$ u(x) = f(x) + \int_{\alpha (x)}^{\beta(x)}\ K(x,t) \ u(t)\ dt. $
is called kernel functions of the equation.
